MacroOp.Name: OMNI_32BIT_BINARY_SEMAPHORE
MacroOp.Brief: If defined, uses 32-bit types in the omni::sync::binary_semaphore class.
MacroOp.Considerations: A lock counter is kept because a semaphore cannot be destroyed while locked; due to this, if a lock operation is preformed more than the maximum value for the underlying lock counter type, an overflow can occur and put the lock into an undefined state. For example, if this flag is defined then the lock's counter type will be 32-bit, thus the maximum number of lock operations that can be preforemd without an unlock operation is std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max().
MacroOp.Description: If defined, the omni::sync::binary_semaphore class will utilize a 32-bit intergral type for its lock counter, versus a 64-bit type.
MacroOp.Notes: See the considerations for this flag.
MacroOp.Synopsis: #define OMNI_32BIT_BINARY_SEMAPHORE Signifies to enable the OMNI_32BIT_BINARY_SEMAPHORE flag and utilize 32-bit types.
